course_title: Studies in African American Literature: 1900 to Present: Passing Miscegenation Hybridty
class_notes:
(Same as AAS 359 1)
An examination of racial passing, miscegenation, and cultural hybridity in 20th-c. African American literature. Explores questions of identity, literary traditions, and the ways passing and "race mixing" create and destabilize the constructions of race, Jim Crow segregation, American history, and Western culture. A topics course dealing with major traditions and issues in African American literature from 1900 to the present.
course_description: A topics course dealing with major traditions and issues in African American literature from 1900 to the present. Possible topics include passing and miscegenation, black novels since 1950, Afrofuturism, and black theater.
